column4: on the Ubuntu download site, next to the 64 bit version it says: Not recommended for daily desktop usage .. all patronizing aside, can someone elaborate what this really means?  Is it simply considered to be "not completely stable"?
more to do with people not knowing whether they have 32 or 64 but figuring big number = better and downloading something incompatible
there's also not a native flash player for 64bit currently, but the ubuntu packages are made to workaround that anyway so in practice it ends up not mattering
